Our existence is made possible by a spirtitual act....and I believe in mind over matter, not matter over mind. God's mind, just by his thoughts created all matter.  This is getting fun. Here we go:
 Saying that people can't prove (the existance of) life is correct. Of course, by that logic, we can't prove that the laws of physics exist even though we observe them all the time. The same applies to the existance of other stars, the theory that bacteria and viruses cause disease, and, of course, the existance of a god. Anyone who thinks they can is fooling themselves. Our existence is made possible by a spirtitual act....and I believe in mind over matter, not matter over mind.

God's mind, just by his thoughts created all matter.

 And, if he is perfect, and perfection cannot arise spontaneously, did he create himself with his own thoughts?

You evolutionists are deluding yourselves if you think you'll ever know the origin of DNA or anything else.

Scientists like to make people think that they have all the answers because they are able to observe things...ie genetics....but if anyone thought about it just for a second they would realize that there's a difference in observing or understanding something and actually creating it.
